basic.description: This course provides students with a foundation for understanding, assessing and mediating environmental exposures. Methods for assessing and communicating about exposures, risks and standards in air, water, soil and food are introduced. Case studies of managing hazardous exposures are reviewed. Environmental health policy implications of global climate, energy use and disaster planning are explored.  PREREQUISITE:  EPID-801, EPID-821 or equivalent, or permission of instructor.
basic.subject: EPID
basic.title: Environmental Public Health
